citation.article-title: Oceanibaculum pacificum sp. nov., isolated from hydrothermal field sediment of the south-west Pacific Ocean
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Oceanibaculum pacificum sp. nov.
Oceanibaculum pacificum (pa.ci′fi.cum. L. neut. adj. pacificum peaceful, pertaining to the Pacific Ocean, where the type strain was isolated).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the emended genus description.
Cells are 1.7–2.1 μm long and 0.5–0.7 μm wide.
Positive for catalase, urease and arginine dihydrolase; negative for lipase (Tween 80), amylase, gelatinase, indole production and nitrate reduction.
On 216L agar plates, forms smooth, grey colonies with regular edges, 1–2 mm in diameter after 72 h incubation at 28 °C, non-pigmented and slightly raised in the centre.
Grows at 10–45 °C (optimum 28–37 °C) but not at 4 or 50 °C after 7 days.

Sensitive to (per disc; Oxoid) ampicillin (10 μg), carbenicillin (100 μg), chloromycetin (30 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), penicillin G (10 μg), polymyxin B (30 U), rifampicin (5 μg), rocephin (30 μg), streptomycin (10 μg), tetracycline (30 μg) and vibramycin (30 μg).

Resistant to cefalexin (30 μg), cefazolin (30 μg), cefobid (30 μg), cephradin (30 μg), clindamycin (2 μg), co-trimoxazole (25 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), furazolidone (15 μg), lincomycin (2 μg), metronidazole (5 μg), minomycin (30 μg), norfloxacin (10 μg), ofloxacin (5 μg), oxacillin (1 μg), piperacillin (100 μg) and vancomycin (30 μg).

In API ZYM tests, positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and valine arylamidase, weakly positive for trypsin and α-chymotrypsin and negative for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase and β-glucuronidase.

Of 95 substrates in the Biolog GN2 system, positive for utilization of cis-aconitic acid, dextrin, d-fructose, glycogen, l-alaninamide, l-alanine, l-proline, methyl pyruvate and α-cyclodextrin and weakly positive for bromosuccinic acid, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, succinamic acid, Tweens 40 and 80, uridine and urocanic acid; negative for the other substrates.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.7 mol%.
The type strain, LMC2up-L3T (=CCTCC AB 209059T =LMG 24859T =MCCC 1A02656T), was isolated from sediment retrieved from a hydrothermal vent field of the Lau Basin in the south-west Pacific Ocean.
